definition: gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)
ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations

sentences.english: You're just a couple of skinny-armed chickens.
sentences.chinese: 你们不过是两个细胳膊细腿的胆小鬼。

sentences.english: Cowards call themselves cautious and misers thrifty.
sentences.chinese: 胆小鬼说自己谨慎，守财奴称自己节俭。

sentences.english: “You are a coward,” Mr. Brown cried out.
sentences.chinese: 布朗先生喊到，“你是个胆小鬼。”

sentences.english: He was the most timorous person in that event.
sentences.chinese: 在那次事件中他是个胆小鬼。

sentences.english: Kill off the Goddamned cowards and we will have a nation of brave men.
sentences.chinese: 干掉所有狗日的胆小鬼，我们的国家将是勇士的天下。

sentences.english: Thee coward was backing, his face being deathly pale, toward another room.
sentences.chinese: 那个胆小鬼向另一个房间退去，脸色煞白。

sentences.english: Gary sure is a chicken-livered guy.
You are nothing but a big coward.
sentences.chinese: 百兽之王不应该是一个胆小鬼，”稻草人说。

sentences.english: Tom was a fraidy-cat and wouldn't go in the water.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆是个胆小鬼，不会下水去的。
爸爸是个没骨头的胆小鬼。

sentences.english: That coward ratted on his fellow-workers.
sentences.chinese: 那个胆小鬼告发了和他一起干活的工人。

sentences.english: With all his boasting, he is a coward.
sentences.chinese: 尽管他大吹大擂，但他还是个胆小鬼。

sentences.english: You could be brillant, but you're coward.
sentences.chinese: 你可以很出色，但是你是个胆小鬼。

sentences.english: The recruits rushed into battle so that no one could gibe at them for cowardice.
sentences.chinese: 为了不被别人嘲笑为胆小鬼，新兵们冲进了战场。

sentences.english: Many would be cowards if they had courage enough.
sentences.chinese: 许多人都是胆小鬼，只是没勇气承认。

definition: a turtle that pulls its head in/(fig.) coward/chicken
greedy for life, afraid of death (idiom); craven and cowardly/clinging abjectly to life/only interested in saving one's neck
see 臨陣退縮|临阵退缩[lin2 zhen4 tui4 suo1]
